sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"拖，拉"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: drag, draw, pull, haul, tug, tow, jerk
means: drag ： 指沿斜坡而上或水平方向缓慢地拖或拉十分沉重的人或物。作借喻时可指把人硬拉扯过来。
draw ： 指将人或物朝出力者的方向拖，不涉及力的大小，含平稳意味，常作借喻用。
pull ： 最普通用词，包含本组其它各词的一些意思，可指朝各个方向拉，侧重一时或突然拉动的动作。
haul ： 指用力拖或拉，不涉及方向，多作航海用词。
tug ： 多指一阵阵地用力拖或拉，但不一定使被拉的人或物移动。
tow ： 特指用绳子或链条等拖或拉本身无动力或无法使用自身动力的东西。

word_mean: pull-off connector 具有打开连接器结构的连接器。
捕捞机械运转时作用于渔具的力。
pull-in torque  又称“整步转矩”。
描述因特网内容提供者和因特网用户之间工作方式的术语。“提取”指用户从网站上“拖下”数据。

sentence.Network_en: The pull-out of the army paves the way for independence.
sentence.Network_cn: 军队的撤出为独立铺平了道路。

sentence.Network_en: I only pull in 15,000 a year as a social worker.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一名社工，我每年仅挣15,000。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly all the men pull out pistols and begin blasting away.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然，所有人都拔出手枪，连续射击。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 动态调度算法采用客户拉（PULL）模式媒体流的调度首先由用户请求驱动，视频服务器根据一定的调度算法响应用户请求;  典型 …
九年级英语单词表 ... stuff 原料；材料 pull 拉；拖；拔 glue 粘贴；胶水.
（1）拉动式(pull)准时化生产 (JIT)－－以最终用户的需求为生产起点。－－强调物流平衡，追求零库存，要求上一道工序加工完的零 …
...对不会失控弹回，所以这是加弹的最佳位置。加弹后继续拉动(Pull)拉杆至扳机上勾，动作(Action)似乎略烦琐些，但安全系数最高。 …

list.abs: 未分类 - - Nicolas’ Blog - Upholstery ... pull no punches 不客气,动真格的 pull off 成功;完成 pull one’s leg 开某人的玩笑.
介词短语_百度百科 ... pull on 穿，戴 pull together 齐心协力 pull up ( 使 ) 停下.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... pull through 使渡过(危险等) pull up (使)停下；拔起(树等) on purpose 为了；故意地.
一些动词加介副词构成的短语动词 - 豆丁网 ... pull up (使)停下 pull out 取出,驶出 put aside 储存,保留.

jx.jx_en_mean: To move away or backward; withdraw
jx.jx_cn_mean: 后退，离开，抽出：移开或向后移；撤退

lj.lj_ly: The limousine pulled away from the curb.

jx.jx_en_mean: To move ahead
jx.jx_cn_mean: 向前推进

lj.lj_ly: The horse pulled away and took the lead in the race.
lj.lj_ls: 这匹马向前冲并在比赛中取得领先

jx.jx_en_mean: To execute an orderly withdrawal, especially of troops.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 撤退：尤指部队执行有秩序的撤退

jx.jx_en_mean: To demolish; destroy
jx.jx_cn_mean: 毁坏；破坏

lj.lj_ly: pull down an old office building.

jx.jx_en_mean: To reduce to a lower level.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 减至一个较低的水平

jx.jx_en_mean: To depress, as in spirits or health.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 衰弱：精神或健康下降

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To draw (money) as wages
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 获得：抽出（钱）作为报酬

jx.jx_en_mean: To arrive at a destination
jx.jx_cn_mean: 到达目的地

jx.jx_en_mean: To rein in; restrain.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 约束；限制

jx.jx_en_mean: To arrest (a criminal suspect, for example).
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逮捕（例如，嫌疑犯）

jx.jx_en_mean: To perform in spite of difficulties or obstacles; bring off
jx.jx_cn_mean: 艰苦地完成：尽管有困难和障碍依然进行；完成，成功

lj.lj_ls: 获取了最后一分钟的胜利

jx.jx_en_mean: To leave or depart
jx.jx_cn_mean: 离开或脱离

lj.lj_ly: The train pulls out at noon.

jx.jx_en_mean: To withdraw, as from a situation or commitment
jx.jx_cn_mean: 退缩：从某种境况或承诺中撤出

lj.lj_ly: After the crash, many Wall Street investors pulled out.
lj.lj_ls: 股市暴跌之后，华尔街的许多投资者都退缩了

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring a vehicle to a stop at a curb or at the side of a road
jx.jx_cn_mean: 暂停在路边：将车辆在路边停住

lj.lj_ly: We pulled over to watch the sunset.

jx.jx_en_mean: To instruct or force (a motorist) to bring his or her vehicle to a stop at a curb or at the side of a road
jx.jx_cn_mean: 命令停在路边：指示或迫使（摩托车）停在路边

lj.lj_ly: The state trooper pulled the speeding motorist over.
lj.lj_ls: 州警命令超速的摩托车手把车停到路边

jx.jx_en_mean: To restore or be restored to sound health.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使恢复，恢复健康：恢复或被恢复到良好的健康状况

jx.jx_en_mean: To come or bring successfully through trouble or illness.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 成功地突破困苦：成功地通过或克服麻烦或疾病

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring or come to a halt.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使停下或停下

jx.jx_en_mean: To move to a position or place ahead, as in a race.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 超前：在比赛中移动到领先的位置或地方

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to convey that something is extremely difficult to do
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［表达事情极为难办时的用语］太难了

lj.lj_ly: it had been like pulling teeth to extract these two small items from Moore.
lj.lj_ls: 从穆尔那里弄到这两条小消息真是太难了。

lj.lj_ly: it had been like pulling teeth to extract these two small items from Moore.
lj.lj_ls: 从穆尔那里弄到这两条小消息真是太难了。

lj.lj_ls: 从穆尔那里弄到这两条小消息真是太难了。

lj.lj_ly: it had been like pulling teeth to extract these two small items from Moore.
lj.lj_ls: 从穆尔那里弄到这两条小消息真是太难了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English pullian 'pluck, snatch'; origin uncertain; the sense has developed from expressing a short sharp action to one of sustained force

entry.def: When you pull something, you hold it firmly and use force in order to move it towards you  or away from its previous position.

example.ex: They have pulled out patients' teeth unnecessarily...
example.tran: 他们毫无必要地拔掉了病人的牙。

example.ex: He pulled on a jersey...
example.tran: 他套上一件运动衫。

entry.def: When you pull an object from a bag, pocket, or cupboard, you put your hand in and bring the object out.

example.ex: Jack pulled the slip of paper from his shirt pocket...
example.tran: 杰克从衬衫口袋里抽出这张纸条。

example.ex: Wade walked quickly to the refrigerator and pulled out another beer.
example.tran: 韦德快步走到冰箱边又拿出一罐啤酒。

entry.def: When a vehicle, animal, or person pulls a cart or piece of machinery, they are attached to it or hold it, so that it moves along behind them when they move forward.

example.ex: This is early-20th-century rural Sussex, when horses still pulled the plough...
example.tran: 这是20世纪早期的萨塞克斯乡村，那时还是用马拉犁。

example.ex: He pulls a rickshaw, probably the oldest form of human taxi service.
example.tran: 他拉黄包车，这可能是人类最古老的载客服务形式了。

entry.def: If you pull yourself or pull a part of your body in a particular direction, you move your body or a part of your body with effort or force.

example.ex: Hughes pulled himself slowly to his feet...
example.tran: 休斯慢慢站了起来。

example.ex: He pulled his arms out of the sleeves...
example.tran: 他把胳膊从袖子里抽出来。

entry.def: When a driver or vehicle pulls to a stop or a halt, the vehicle stops.

example.ex: He pulled to a stop behind a pickup truck...
example.tran: 他在一辆皮卡货车后面停了下来。

example.ex: The train pulled to a halt at the platform.
example.tran: 火车在站台边停下。

entry.def: In a race or contest, if you pull ahead of or pull away from an opponent, you gradually increase the amount by which you are ahead of them.

example.ex: He pulled away, extending his lead to 15 seconds...
example.tran: 他把领先优势逐渐扩大到了15秒。

example.ex: The six states he won in 1988 are the same states in which he has yet to pull ahead of his opponent.
example.tran: 1988年他获胜的6个州也是他目前有待领先于对手的几个州。

entry.def: If you pull something apart, you break or divide it into small pieces, often in order to put them back together again in a different way.

example.ex: If I wanted to improve the car significantly I would have to pull it apart and start again.
example.tran: 如果想好好地改进这辆车，我将不得不把它拆开重装。

entry.def: If someone pulls a gun or a knife on someone else, they take out a gun or knife and threaten the other person with it.

example.ex: They had a fight. One of them pulled a gun on the other...
example.tran: 他们打了起来。其中一人拔出枪指着另一个人。

example.ex: I pulled a knife and threatened her.
example.tran: 我拔出刀威胁她。

entry.tran: 吸引，拉拢（人群、观众或选民）
entry.def: To pull crowds, viewers, or voters means to attract them.

example.ex: The organisers have to employ performers to pull a crowd.
example.tran: 组织者不得不雇些演员来聚拢人气。

entry.def: If something pulls you or pulls your thoughts or feelings in a particular direction, it strongly attracts you or influences you in a particular way.

example.ex: Joe felt there was little he could do to help Betty, and his heart was pulling him elsewhere.
example.tran: 乔感到帮不上贝蒂什么忙，他的心思在别的地方。

entry.def: A pull is a strong physical force which causes things to move in a particular direction.

example.ex: ...the pull of gravity.
example.tran: 重力的牵引

entry.def: If you are pulling for someone, you support and encourage them, especially in a competition.

example.ex: We're all pulling for each other because we're desperate to win the Cup back...
example.tran: 因为我们非常想赢回奖杯，所以一直在互相打气。

example.ex: You know I've been pulling for you.
example.tran: 你知道我一直在为你加油。

entry.def: If you pull a muscle, you injure it by straining it.

example.ex: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball...
example.tran: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

example.ex: He suffered a pulled calf muscle.
example.tran: 他小腿肚肌肉拉伤。

entry.def: If someone pulls on a cigarette, they take a deep breath with the cigarette in their mouth.

example.ex: Jeff leaned back and pulled on his cigarette.
example.tran: 杰夫往后一靠，深深地吸了一口烟。

entry.def: To pull a stunt or a trick on someone means to do something dramatic or silly in order to get their attention or trick them.

example.ex: Everyone saw the stunt you pulled on me.
example.tran: 大家都看见了你对我耍的花招。

entry.def: If someone pulls someone else, they succeed in attracting them sexually and in spending the rest of the evening or night with them.
You can say to someone 'Pull the other one' or 'Pull the other one, it's got bells on' to tell them that you do not believe what they have told you and you think they must be joking.

example.ex: What! A big bloke like you, beaten by his wife! Pull the other one; it's got bells on.
example.tran: 什么！你这么一个大块头居然被他的妻子打了！别逗了。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of pulling; applying force to move something toward or with you;

sentences.sentence: "the pull up the hill had him breathing harder"
"the chairman's nephew has a lot of pull"

means.word_mean: 4. a device used for pulling something;

sentences.sentence: "he grabbed the pull and opened the drawer"

means.word_mean: 5. a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments;

sentences.sentence: "the wrench to his knee occurred as he fell"
"he was sidelined with a hamstring pull"

means.word_mean: 6. a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke);

sentences.sentence: "he took a puff on his pipe"
"he took a drag on his cigarette and expelled the smoke slowly"
"it was a long pull but we made it"

means.word_mean: 1. cause to move along the ground by pulling;
2. direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes;

sentences.sentence: "Her good looks attract the stares of many men"
"The ad pulled in many potential customers"
"The store owner was happy that the ad drew in many new customers"

means.word_mean: 4. apply force so as to cause motion towards the source of the motion;
5. perform an act, usually with a negative connotation;
6. bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover;

sentences.sentence: "The mugger pulled a knife on his victim"
"I pulled a muscle in my leg when I jumped up"
"The athlete pulled a tendon in the competition"

means.word_mean: 9. cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense;

sentences.sentence: "A declining dollar pulled down the export figures for the last quarter"

means.word_mean: 11. rein in to keep from winning a race;

sentences.sentence: "The curtain ripped from top to bottom"

means.word_mean: 13. hit in the direction that the player is facing when carrying through the swing;
15. draw or pull out, usually with some force or effort; also used in an abstract sense;
16. take sides with; align oneself with; show strong sympathy for;

sentences.sentence: "We all rooted for the home team"
"Are you siding with the defender of the title?"
"pull the old soup cans from the supermarket shelf"

list.explanation: 利用一切可以利用的东西，继续全力以赴

example.en: Then the mayor decided to pull out all the stops.
example.zh: 于是市长作出决定，继续全力以赴。

list.explanation: 同某人开玩笑，取笑或捉弄某人

example.en: I suspected that he was pulling my leg.
example.zh: 我怀疑他当时是在跟我开玩笑。

auth_sentence.content: Iraqi forces torch oil wells as they pull out.
auth_sentence.res_content: Iraqi forces torch oil wells as they pull out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Iraqi forces torch oil wells as they pull out.

auth_sentence.content: Whats needed is the insight to pull it off.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whats needed is the insight to pull it off.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whats needed is the insight to pull it off.

auth_sentence.content: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.
auth_sentence.res_content: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The worm stretch and pull itself to move forward.

Sentence.sentence: Next he pulls up a music composition textbook, complete with playable demos.
It will force them to pull their efforts together
We tend to think of the Depression as a time when families pulled together to survive huge job losses, By 1932.
When it gets a little boring, I might pull it out," acknowledged Naomi Pugh, a first-year student at Freed- Hardeman University in Henderson, Tenn.
Thank goodness, David pulled us out of the hole on that one.

sentences.en: The horse on the left side isn't pulling.
sentences.cn: 左边的那匹马没有用力拉车。

sentences.en: Let's go over and help them pull the cart.

means.word_mean: 拉过来, 拉动, 移动

sentences.en: She pulled the fence to pieces with her bare hands.
sentences.cn: 她用双手把篱笆拆了下来。
这条船是由四只桨划的。

means.word_mean: 赢得, 招来, 吸引

sentences.en: He's not popular enough to pull many votes.
sentences.cn: 他因不受爱戴而未能赢得更多选票。

sentences.en: He's hoping to pull the girl with his new car.
sentences.cn: 他希望用自己那辆新车吸引那个女孩子。

sentences.en: It was a long hard pull for him to get to the top of his position.
sentences.cn: 他费了九牛二虎之力终于爬上了最高位置。

jushi.english: Help me move the piano over here; you push and I'll pull.
jushi.chinese: 帮我把钢琴搬过来,你用力推,我来拉。
